content:
Hey All, we now have an open TestScript call scheduled to discuss possible design changes to the TestScript resource that we can test during the upcoming Connectathon. Feel free to join with any questions/topics/ideas/etc. that we can discuss and be ready to discuss all the grand ideas I have myself. The call is currently scheduled for every other Thursday at 10am EST starting April 1. If you want to participate but can not make that time please reach out here or you can message me directly and we'll work to find a time that works for everyone.
Full info: http://www.hl7.org/concalls/CallDetails.cfm?concall=54982
Are we going to have a call today?
For everyone else (because Ilya is in the call now) yes we are having the call today, there were just some technical difficulties that delayed us at the start but we've started and are meeting now.

For everyone interested in our bi-weekly call leading up to the Connectathon I have created a Doodle Poll for proposed times next week - https://doodle.com/poll/u59gs2xi46x7zmn2?utm_source=poll&utm_medium=link

Please select the time(s) that work best for you. We'll close the poll this Friday, April 9th.

Also, I have created a place for our meeting notes on the HL7 Confluence site - https://confluence.hl7.org/display/FHIRI/FHIR+Testing+and+TestScript+Minutes.

Thank you for everyone who attended last week's call. Looking forward to next week's call.
@Richard Ettema Is the meeting time settled?
Yes the meeting this week will be Friday April 16th at 10 EST, we are just having some hiccups in updating the HL7 page to reflect that, sorry for not informing everyone sooner.

We now have the updated call information on the HL7 Conference Call site - http://www.hl7.org/concalls/CallDetails.cfm?concall=55018

As Ryan stated, we will be meeting Friday April 16 at 10:00am ET. Looking forward to continuing the conversation.
